analyzed: niraupamya stavaḥ
translated: The Hymn of Incomparability

analyzed: niraupamya namaḥ tubhyam niḥsvabhāva artha vādine
translated: Incomparability, homage to you, the one who teaches the meaning of essencelessness,

analyzed: yaḥ tvam dṛṣṭi vipannasya lokasya eva hita udyataḥ
translated: You who are dedicated to the welfare of the world afflicted by wrong views.

original: na ca nāma tvayā kiñcid dṛṣṭaṃ bauddhena cakṣuṣā /
analyzed: na ca nāma tvayā kiñcid dṛṣṭam bauddhena cakṣuṣā
translated: And indeed, nothing was seen by you with the Buddha-eye,

analyzed: anuttarā ca te nātha dṛṣṭiḥ tattva artha darśinī  /
translated: And your unsurpassed vision, O Lord, sees the truth of reality.

original: na boddhā na ca boddhavyamastīha paramārthataḥ /
analyzed: na boddhā na ca boddhavyam asti iha paramārthataḥ
translated: There is no knower and nothing to be known here in the ultimate sense,

analyzed: aho parama durbodhām dharmatām buddhavān asi
translated: Ah! You have realized the ultimate truth, which is extremely difficult to understand.

original: na tvayotpāditaḥ kaścid dharmo nāpi nirodhitaḥ /
analyzed: na tvayā utpāditaḥ kaścid dharmaḥ na api nirodhitaḥ
translated: No dharma was produced by you, nor was any ceased,

original: samatādarśanenaiva prāptaṃ padamanuttamam // //🔽na saṃsārātprakarṣeṇa tvayā nirvāṇamīpsitam /
analyzed: sama tā darśanena eva prāptam padam anuttamam  na saṃsārāt prakarṣeṇa tvayā nirvāṇam īpsitam
translated: The unsurpassed state was attained by you alone through the vision of equality.🔽You did not desire nirvana by transcending samsara,

analyzed: śāntiḥ te dhigatā nātha saṃsāra anaparādhitaḥ
translated: O Lord, peace was attained by you without transgressing samsara.

analyzed: tvam viveda eka rasa tām saṃkleśa vyavadānayoḥ
translated: You know the oneness of the essence of defilement and purification,

analyzed: dharmadhātu avinirbhedāt viśuddhaḥ ca asi sarvatas
translated: And you are completely pure due to the indivisibility of the dharmadhatu.

analyzed: na udāhṛtam tvayā kiñcid ekam api akṣaram vibho
translated: Not a single syllable was uttered by you, O Lord,

analyzed: kṛtsnaḥ ca vaineya janaḥ dharma varṣeṇa tarpitaḥ
translated: And the entire class of disciples was satisfied by the rain of Dharma.

original: na te'sti saktiḥ skandheṣu na dhātvāyataneṣu ca /
analyzed: na teḥ asti saktiḥ skandheṣu na dhātu āyataneṣu ca
translated: You have no attachment to the aggregates, nor to the elements and sense bases.

analyzed: ākāśa sama cittaḥ tvam sarva dharmeṣu niśritaḥ
translated: Your mind is like space, you are based on all phenomena.

original: sattvasaṃjñā ca te nātha sarvathā na pravartate /
analyzed: sattva saṃjñā ca te nātha sarvathā na pravartate
translated: And, protector, your perception of beings does not operate in any way.

original: duḥkhārteṣu ca sattveṣu tvamatīva kṛpātmakaḥ // //🔽sukhaduḥkhātmanairātmyanityānityādiṣu prabho /
analyzed: duḥkha ārteṣu ca sattveṣu tvam atīva kṛpā ātmakaḥ  sukha duḥkha ātma nairātmya nitya anitya ādiṣu prabho
translated: And you are extremely compassionate towards beings afflicted with suffering.

original: iti nānāvikalpeṣu buddhistava na sajjate // //🔽na gatirnāgatiḥ kāciddharmāṇāmiti te mati /
analyzed: iti nānā vikalpeṣu buddhiḥ tava na sajjate  na gatiḥ na agatiḥ kācid dharmāṇām iti te mati
translated: O Lord, your mind is not attached to various concepts such as happiness, suffering, self, selflessness, permanence, impermanence, and so on.🔽You have the view that phenomena have no coming or going.

analyzed: na kvacid rāśitaḥ proktaḥ dharma artha parama artha vid
translated: You, who know the ultimate meaning of the Dharma, are said to be not dwelling anywhere.

analyzed: sarvatra anugataḥ ca asi na ca yātaḥ asi kutracid
translated: You pervade everywhere, yet you have not gone anywhere.

analyzed: janma dharma śarīrābhyām acintyaḥ tvam mahā mune
translated: O Great Sage, you are inconceivable in terms of the birth body and the Dharma body.

analyzed: ekatva anyatva rahitam pratiśrutkā upamam jagat
translated: The world is like an echo, devoid of oneness and otherness.

analyzed: saṃkrānti nāśāya gatam buddhavān tvam anindita  śāśvata uccheda rahitam lakṣya lakṣaṇa varjitam
translated: You, the blameless one, have realized the non-transference and non-destruction of phenomena.

analyzed: saṃsāram avabuddhaḥ tvam svapna māyā ādi vat prabho
translated: O Lord, you have realized cyclic existence as devoid of permanence and annihilation, and free from the characterized and the characteristic, like a dream, an illusion, and so on.

analyzed: vāsanā mūla paryanta kleśa nadyaḥ vinirjitāḥ
translated: The rivers of afflictions that have their root in latent tendencies have been conquered by you.

analyzed: kleśa prakṛtitaḥ ca eva tvayā amṛtam upārjitam
translated: And by the very nature of afflictions, you have attained immortality.

analyzed: alakṣaṇam tvayā dhīram dṛṣṭam rūpam arūpa vat
translated: You, the steadfast one, have seen form as formless, devoid of characteristics.

analyzed: lakṣaṇa ujjvala gātraḥ ca dṛśyase rūpa gocare
translated: And you appear resplendent with the marks of a great being within the domain of form.

original: na ca rūpeṇa dṛṣṭena dṛṣṭa ityabhidhīyase /
analyzed: na ca rūpeṇa dṛṣṭena dṛṣṭaḥ iti abhidhīyase
translated: You are not said to be seen by one who sees form with the eyes.

original: dharmadṛṣṭyā sudṛṣṭo'si dharmatā na ca dṛśyate // //
analyzed: dharma dṛṣṭyā su dṛṣṭaḥ asi dharma tā na ca dṛśyate
translated: You are well seen by the vision of the Dharma, but the nature of phenomena is not seen.

original: śauṣīryo nāsti te kāyo māṃsāsthirudhiro na ca /
analyzed: śauṣīryaḥ nā asti te kāyaḥ māṃsa asthi rudhiraḥ na ca
translated: Your body is not solid, nor does it consist of flesh, bones, or blood.

analyzed: indrāyudham iva kāyam vinā darśitavān asi
translated: You have shown your body to be like a rainbow, devoid of substance.

original: nāmayo nāśuciḥ kāye kṣuttṛṣṇāsambhavo na ca /
analyzed: na āmayaḥ na aśuciḥ kāye kṣudh tṛṣṇā sambhavaḥ na ca
translated: There is no impurity in your body, nor is there hunger or thirst.

analyzed: tvayā loka anuvṛtti artham darśitā laukikī kriyā
translated: You have displayed worldly activities in accordance with worldly conventions.

analyzed: karma āvaraṇa doṣaḥ ca sarvathā anagha nā asti te
translated: And you have no fault of obscuration due to karma in any way.

analyzed: tvayā loka anukampāyai karma plotiḥ pradarśitā
translated: You have shown the course of karma out of compassion for the world.

analyzed: dharmadhātoḥ asaṃbhedāt yāna bhedaḥ asti na prabho
translated: O Lord, there is no difference in vehicles due to the indivisibility of the dharmadhatu.

analyzed: yāna tritayam ākhyātam tvayā sattva avatārataḥ
translated: The three vehicles have been taught by you for the sake of guiding beings.

original: nityo dhruvaḥ śivaḥ kāyastava dharmamayo jina /
analyzed: nityaḥ dhruvaḥ śivaḥ kāyaḥ tava dharma mayaḥ jina
translated: O Victorious One, your body is eternal, stable, and auspicious, consisting of the Dharma.

analyzed: vineya jana hetoḥ ca darśitā nirvṛtiḥ tvayā  lokadhātuṣu asaṃkhyeṣu tvad bhaktaiḥ punar īkṣase
translated: And for the sake of the disciples, you have shown nirvana.🔽In countless world systems, you are seen again and again

analyzed: cyuti janma abhisaṃbodhi cakra nirvṛti lālasaiḥ
translated: By those devoted to you, longing for passing away, birth, enlightenment, turning the wheel, and nirvana.

original: na te'sti manyanā nātha na vikalpo na ceñjanā /
analyzed: na testi manyanā nā atha na vikalpaḥ na ca iñjanā
translated: O Lord, you have no conceit, no conceptualization, no agitation.

original: anābhogena te loke buddhakṛtyaṃ pravartate // //🔽iti sugatamacintyamaprameyaṃ
analyzed: anābhogena te loke buddha kṛtyam pravartate  iti sugatam acintyam aprameyam
translated: Without effort, your Buddha activity proceeds in the world.

analyzed: guṇa kusumaiḥ avakīrya mayā prāptam
translated: Thus, having scattered flowers of praise to the inconceivable and immeasurable Sugata,

analyzed: kuśalam iha bhavantu tena sattvāḥ
translated: May beings attain virtue through this,

analyzed: parama gabhīra muni indra dharma bhājanāḥ
translated: And become vessels for the profound Dharma of the great sage.

analyzed: niraupamya stavaḥ samāptaḥ
translated: The praise without parallel is complete.
